intro: Zschokkea pauciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered zschokkea, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant native to the Andean regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
